Key Arguments: The legislation would make science, research, learning, and teaching illegal by restricting access to information.
The bill is an attack on free speech and democracy, giving censor powers to an unelected body.
The bill excludes government and mainstream media, allowing them to propagate propaganda.
ACMA's unelected status poses a threat to democracy by potentially silencing opposition.
The harms defined in the bill are already covered by defamation law, making the bill unnecessary.
Notable Quotes: Unless ACMA has perfect knowledge of the entire universe, this bill will make science illegal.
This bill will restrict explaining 'the other side', making unbiased journalism illegal, turning it all into 'propaganda'.
This bill seems to suggest that individuals do not have the ability to test information, compare opposing ideas and make a personal judgement as to what constitutes 'the truth.'
This is a REAL threat to democracy, and the way autocratic dictators deny their citizens access to information to control them.
